## Run simulation
```{r}
N <- 350
k <- 10
runs <- 10000
mom_statistic <- numeric(runs)
mle_statistic <- numeric(runs)
custom1_statistic <- numeric(runs)
custom2_statistic <- numeric(runs)
for(i in 1:runs) {
  sample_values <- sample(1:N, k)
  mom_statistic[i] <- 2*mean(sample_values) - 1
  mle_statistic[i] <- max(sample_values)
  # custom 1
  # custom 2
}
```

## Compare estimators
So far looks like mom is less biased but mle has smaller variance
```{r}
summary(mom_statistic)
var(mom_statistic)
summary(mle_statistic)
var(mle_statistic)
```
